EXTINGUISHMENT OF A LEGACY
(1) A legacy shall be extinguished when the legatee dies before the testator, when he or she renounces his or her legacy, or when he or she is unworthy of the legacy.
(2) In such cases, the object of the legacy shall remain the property of the person who should have fulfilled it, unless it can be determined from the will that the testator intended otherwise.
